p: Among the 6,720 respondents, 92.9% were males as head of the households and the mean duration of their stay in that particular area was 30 years (median+ 25, SD+15). Table 1 presents the socio-demographic characteristics of the participants. The majority were day labourers or farmers (60%), and almost 90% earned a monthly income of below 12,000 Bangladeshi Taka (BDT) (156 US$ approx. in 2015). As per the BMI categories for developing countries, about 22% of the participants were underweight, almost 22% were overweight, and 4% were obese ( Table 1).
